page.title: 20ATTITUDES
page.content: The area holds in somewhat strange tension the fact that while it needs Tourism and its financial benefits, the weight of many thousand visitors, and especially their cars, bears heavily upon local facilities - including a road system virtually unchanged from days of horse traffic. Moreover, to find it almost impossible to shop in normally relaxed style is trying to elderly residents. However, it can truly be said that many visitors have been coming for so many years that 'locals' see them genuinely as friends. A tension indeed - but one with which the area has lived, and must continue to live. Researched by members of St. Merryn Women's Institute, and compiled by Mrs. Ann Boultbee, Hon. Secretary. Photographs taken by the Rev. Michael Boultbee, Vicar of St. Merryn.
